a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes tan :: "real \<Rightarrow> real" and n :: real
assumes h0 : "prod (\<lambda>i. 1 + tan i) {1..45} = 2 powr n"
shows  "n = 23"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 If
\[(1 + \tan 1^\circ)(1 + \tan 2^\circ)(1 + \tan 3^\circ) \dotsm (1 + \tan 45^\circ) = 2^n,\]then find $n.$ The final Answer is 23
 ### Proof
 Note that for any angle $x,$ from the angle subtraction formula, \begin{align} (1 + \tan x)(1 + \tan (45^\circ - x)) &= (1 + \tan x) \left( 1 + \frac{\tan 45^\circ - \tan x}{1 + \tan 45^\circ \tan x} \right) \\
 &= (1 + \tan x) \left( 1 + \frac{1 - \tan x}{1 + \tan x} \right) \\ &= 1 + \tan x + 1 - \tan x \\ &= 2. \end{align}Thus, taking $x = 1^\circ,$ $2^\circ,$ $\dots,$ $22^\circ,$ we get \begin{align} (1 + \tan 1^\circ)(1 + \tan 44^\circ) &= 2, \\
 (1 + \tan 2^\circ)(1 + \tan 43^\circ) &= 2, \\ &\dots, \\ (1 + \tan 22^\circ)(1 + \tan 23^\circ) &= 2. \end{align}Hence, \[(1 + \tan 1^\circ)(1 + \tan 2^\circ)(1 + \tan 23^\circ) \dotsm (1 + \tan 44^\circ) = 2^{22}.\]Then
 \[(1 + \tan 1^\circ)(1 + \tan 2^\circ)(1 + \tan 23^\circ) \dotsm (1 + \tan 44^\circ)(1 + \tan 45^\circ) = 2^{23},\]which means $n = \boxed{23}.$
 *)

a_9.formal problem:
theorem
fixes n :: real and tan :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"

shows  "n = 23"
a_9.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 If
\[(1 + \tan 1^\circ)(1 + \tan 2^\circ)(1 + \tan 3^\circ) \dotsm (1 + \tan 45^\circ) = 2^n,\]then find $n.$ The final Answer is 23

 *)

theorem
fixes n :: real and tan :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. tan x = tan (x * pi / 180)"
and h1 : "prod (\<lambda>x. 1 + tan x) {1..45} = 2 powr n"
shows  "n = 23"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_9.informal problem: Calculate the product of the terms in the sequence $1 + \tan(x)$ for $x$ from 1 to 45, where $\tan(x)$ is the tangent of $x$ degrees. If this product is equal to $2^n$, find the value of $n$. The final answer is $n = 23$.
